headline: As X loses its CEO, daily usage is down and competition is growing
summary: X is still the dominant social media platform, but its daily active user base has declined and competitor Threads is seeing higher rates of growth.

headline: MS resumes Verizon at Equal-Weight, sees limited upside without wireless gains
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley resumed coverage of Verizon (NYSE:VZ) with an Equal-Weight rating and a $47 price target, saying the telecom giant’s low valuation and expected free cash flow boost from tax changes are offset by tepid EBITDA growth and lingering questions around consumer wireless momentum.

headline: Verizon Pledges $100,000 to Texas Flood Relief, Waives Customer Fees in Affected Areas
summary: Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE:VZ) is one of the most undervalued NYSE stocks to buy now. In response to the severe flash floods that struck Central Texas on July 4, Verizon pledged support for affected customers. The company is donating $100,000 to Texas Search and Rescue/TEXSAR, which is a volunteer-based first responder organization dedicated to rescue […]

headline: Azul and RapidFort Partner to Deliver Near-Zero CVE Enterprise Grade Java Container Images, Backed by Commercial Java Support
summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif. & PALO ALTO, Calif., July 10, 2025--Azul, the only company 100% focused on Java, and RapidFort, the industry leader in software supply chain security, today announced a strategic partnership to deliver near-zero Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) third-party container images backed by Azul’s world-class Java support. This partnership, which combines Azul’s entire commercial Java portfolio, including Azul Platform Core and Azul Platform Prime, with RapidFort Curated Ima

headline: Why buybacks are replacing dividends in corporate America
summary: S&P 500 (^GSPC) dividend yields are nearing record lows, raising questions about whether investors still value steady income from stocks. Victoria Fernandez, chief market strategist at Crossmark Global Investments, joins Opening Bid to explain why more companies are opting for buybacks over dividends, and why she thinks Verizon (VZ) is a top dividend pick. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid here.
